Data: Whenever possible, Creative Commons CC0 (default) or other recommended standard licenses
Code and software: Whenever possible, recommended standard licenses for code/software, preferably European Union Public Licence, Version 1.2 or later (EUPL) or MIT License.
Other digital objects: Sometimes depositors want to archive and publish project reports and similar publications related to data as part of the dataset. We usually recommend other repositories or publishing venues for such resources. If to be included in our repository, we recommend applying Creative Commons CC0 or CC BY, or another recommended standard license to this kind of resources.

Data:
Archiving Plus/Premium 
 - Access categories defined in Usage Regulations (classes 0 and A: the data can be downloaded directly and free of charge after registration; classes B and C (i.e., data is only passed on after approval by the data depositor) can be ordered with costs after registration) (see https://www.gesis.org/en/data-services/share-data/how-to-guide-data-sharing "Access")
 Archiving BASIS 
 - Access categories defined in Terms of Use (Free without registration, Free with registration, Restricted, Embargo) (see https://www.gesis.org/en/data-services/share-data/how-to-guide-data-sharing "Access")
 - Creative Commons licenses
 - Free license text
Code and software:
- Access categories defined in Terms of Use (Free without registration, Free with registration, Restricted, Embargo) (see https://www.gesis.org/en/data-services/share-data/how-to-guide-data-sharing "Access")
 - Creative Commons licenses
 - Free license text
